revised_title: A New Canonical Form for Complex Symmetric Matrices in Physics
tldr: The author presents a block diagonal canonical form for complex symmetric matrices, which is orthogonally similar to a diagonal matrix. This new form consists of diagonal or quasi-diagonal blocks, where each block has a repeated eigenvalue and an isotropic eigenvector. This canonical form is useful in various applications, such as wave propagation in continuous media and gravitational fields in the general theory of relativity.
